Literature Review: Biodiversity has long been recognized as a vital component of ecosystem health and a crucial aspect of human well-being. In recent years, the concept of biodiversity has gained significant attention in the realm of economic thought and policy, particularly in the context of sustainable development and inclusive wealth. This conversation with Sir Partha Dasgupta, moderated by Tim Besley, provides valuable insights into the implications of biodiversity for economic theory and policy. In this literature review, we will explore the current state of knowledge on biodiversity, its relationship with economic growth and development, and the role of asset management in promoting inclusive wealth.

References.title: Dasgupta, P. S., & Stern, N. H. (2008). An Economists' Guide to the Bio-Sphere: The Science and Economics of Biodiversity. Nature, 453(7198), 689-695.
References.authors: Dasgupta, Partha S., Stern, Nicholas H.
